main event: A sighting of an unidentified flying object occurred on December 3, 1948, at Fairfield-Suisun Air Force Base in California. The object appeared as a brilliant white light, approximately 30 inches in diameter, and performed rapid but erratic climbing maneuvers before disappearing from sight.
interesting points: The object initially appeared at an altitude of 500 to 1000 feet and climbed to an estimated 20,000 feet, exhibiting varying speeds from 400 MPH to 200 MPH before a rapid climb out of sight.
No sound or trail was observed from the object, and it shone with the brightness of a high-intensity runway light.
The only object observed was approximately the size of a 30-foot diameter searchlight and exhibited an erratic climb similar to a change to space.
The sighting was verified to have occurred at the specified time, place, and under clear weather conditions.
The altitude, speed, and behaviors exhibited by the object do not fit conventional explanations, such as meteors or known meteorological or astronomical phenomena.
sighted object: brilliant white light, 30 inches in diameter
